p: Antiproliferative activity of plants may be attributed to the presence of alkaloids, glycosides, saponins, and polyacetylenes [ 46]. A previous phytochemical study on Caralluma species suggested the presence of glycosides and saponins [ 47]. Saponins are natural compounds that have several pharmacological activities like antiproliferative properties [ 48, 49], with pronounced effects on malignant tumor cells [ 9].
